description: The MSS notification sent on DoS attack
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSDenialOfService SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsDoSType i 1 SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsSrcAddr a 192.0.2.1 SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsDstAddr a 192.0.2.1 SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsDstPort i 9999 SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsCount C 9999 SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsIpProtocol i 0 RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsSrcMACAddr s EXAMPLE

description: Enumeration of DoS attacks
variables.name: SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsDoSType

description: Source IP address in IP header. Set to 0.0.0.0 if address is unknown
variables.name: SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsSrcAddr

description: Destination IP address in IP header. Set to 0.0.0.0 if address is unknown
variables.name: SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsDstAddr

description: Destination port number in IP header. 0 if port is not applicable or
unknown
variables.name: SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsDstPort

description: Counted number of events that occur in a given period
for a corresponding class of security violations (DoS,
not authorized access, etc).
variables.name: SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsCount

description: The protocol field in IP header
variables.name: SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsIpProtocol

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: Source Physical address (MAC) of a packet identified
as a packet carrying DoS payload. Set to 00:00:00:00:00:00 when phyicial address
is not supported or unknown to the system
variables.name: SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avMSSVarbindsSrcMACAddr

description: Encryption keys mismatch error. Configuration download
operation is aborted
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avConfigurationEncKeyMismatchFault G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapSubsystem s EXAM G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapOnBoard s EXAM G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapLocation s EXAMPLE LOAD-MIB::genAppFileId i 9999 LOAD-MIB::genAppFileName s EXAMPLE LOAD-MIB::genAppFileVersionNumber s EXAMPLE LOAD-MIB::genOpLastFailureDisplay s EXAMPLE

description: The high-level subsystem that generated the trap.
Expected values are 'HW', 'SW', and 'Net'.
variables.name: G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapSubsystem

description: Expected values are 'no' and 'yes'. If a problem is on-board
replacing the media module is likely to resolve the problem.
variables.name: G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapOnBoard

description: Location of the problem in the form gggVspp, where
ggg Media gateway number, or zero if the gateway is not
currently registered with any controller.
V The letter V; a field separator.
s Slot number, if applicable. If the fault occurred on
the media gateway processor, this will be omitted.
pp Port number, if applicable. If the fault occurred on
the media gateway processor or on a media module as a
whole, this will be omitted.
variables.name: G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapLocation

description: Index which uniquely identifies the application.
NOTE: This index CANNOT BE ZERO (0) since the index of zero is
reserved as an indication of network server location in the
genOpSourceIndex and genOpDestIndex above.
variables.name: LOAD-MIB::genAppFileId

description: The name of the application.
variables.name: LOAD-MIB::genAppFileName

description: The current version of the application. If this files does not
carry a version this field should be NULL.
variables.name: LOAD-MIB::genAppFileVersionNumber

description: Contains the last error, Null if there is no error.
variables.name: LOAD-MIB::genOpLastFailureDisplay

description: Configuration Master key was changed
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SECURITY-MANAGEMENT-MIB::avConfigurationMasterKeyChange G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapSubsystem s EXAM G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapOnBoard s EXAM G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapLocation s EXAMPLE

description: The high-level subsystem that generated the trap.
Expected values are 'HW', 'SW', and 'Net'.
variables.name: G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapSubsystem

description: Expected values are 'no' and 'yes'. If a problem is on-board
replacing the media module is likely to resolve the problem.
variables.name: G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapOnBoard

description: Location of the problem in the form gggVspp, where
ggg Media gateway number, or zero if the gateway is not
currently registered with any controller.
V The letter V; a field separator.
s Slot number, if applicable. If the fault occurred on
the media gateway processor, this will be omitted.
pp Port number, if applicable. If the fault occurred on
the media gateway processor or on a media module as a
whole, this will be omitted.
variables.name: G700-MG-MIB::cmgTrapLocation

event.Summary: User password is about to expire in $v3 days
